article_text:
The tangled web of South Asian relations was visible on the sidelines of the global climate summit in Paris last week. Pakistan’s Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif met with Afghanistan’s President Ashraf Ghani. More dramatically, Mr. Sharif sat with India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi at a time when no formal talks were being held between the two countries.

As an apparent consequence, the national-security advisers of India and Pakistan met Sunday in Bangkok, followed by news that India’s external-affairs minister will visit...

twitter.description: Pakistan continues to back the Taliban, leaving Afghanistan looking to India again, says Harsh V. Pant in The Wall Street Journal.
twitter.title: South Asia’s Tangled Peace Process

image.alt: South Asia’s Tangled Peace Process - a WSJ op-ed
